conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volumes read as rooms, and the ceiling/roof is removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall corners and clear room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification/softness in some wall junctions and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and major zones (two bedrooms, living/dining, kitchen, bathroom core) mostly match, but several wall/partition details and opening placements do not closely follow the 2D plan (notably the bathroom/core partitioning and entry/corridor definition).

interior_elements.notes: Bedrooms, living seating, dining set, and basic kitchen elements are present. Bathroom is incomplete vs plan (key fixtures/arrangement mismatch; toilet not clearly present).

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry and consistent materials with good visibility. Some openings/doors are ambiguous (door panels/swings not represented), reducing structural clarity.

detected_errors.description: Core/bathroom partitioning and some wall positions do not align tightly with the 2D plan; corridor/entry definition appears simplified/shifted.
Door and opening placements are not faithfully represented (no clear door leaves/swings; some openings appear relocated or resized).
Bathroom fixture set/placement does not match the plan (toilet not clearly present; shower/vanity arrangement inconsistent).
Simplified modeling of architectural details (frames/trim/thresholds) reduces fidelity but does not invalidate 3D conversion.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric modeling, but only moderate plan fidelity due to notable bathroom/core and opening/door mismatches.
